data.title: Auburn Library
data.text:
On Saturday afternoon July 16, 2016 Louis and I went to Auburn Library in Cranston, Rhode Island.
This library is just like the Oak Lawn one very small and quiet.
This is very convenient and easy for us to get to since it is right down the street from where we live.
It was the first library that we went to when we moved to Cranston.
People know us very well are very friendly and nice.
The hours are: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday 10:00 A.M.- 6:00 P.M.
Saturday 10:00 A.M.-5:00 P.M. Closed on holidays, Thursdays, and Sundays.
Louis and I always enjoy going to the library.
CD's, videos, paperback books, hard cover books are sold there at different prices.
Magazines and newspapers quite a selection to choose from.
Candy bars are $1.50.
They also sell lollipops.
All libraries have a children's room.
Thank You.

owner_response.author: Katy D, Public Relations Manager at Cranston Public Library, Auburn Branch, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the kind words, Debra! The Auburn Branch is a much-beloved neighborhood location.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
